channel.title: Rock & Roll on Themes from Art: Poems, Paintings, Pop and Pictures
channel.description: Recent content in Rock & Roll on Themes from Art: Poems, Paintings, Pop and Pictures

item.title: Decisions, from "Do You Believe In Magic", a song by the Lovin' Spoonful
item.description: “Do You Believe in Magic” (Lovin’ Spoonful) Did you ever have to make up your mind? Pick up on one and leave the other one behind It’s not often easy, and not often kind Did you ever have to make up your mind? Did you ever have to finally decide? Say yes to one and let the other one ride There’s so many changes, and tears you must hide Did you ever have to finally decide?

item.title: Alcohol 'Margaritaville' by Jimmy Buffet
item.description: “Margaritaville” (Jimmy Buffet) Nibblin' on sponge cake Watchin' the sun bake All of those tourists covered with oil Strummin' my six string On my front porch swing Smell those shrimp, they’re beginnin' to boil Wastin' away again in Margaritaville Searchin' for my lost shaker of salt Some people claim that there’s a woman to blame But I know, it’s nobody’s fault Don’t know the reason Stayed here all season Nothing to show but this brand new tattoo But it’s a real beauty A Mexican cutie How it got here, I haven’t a clue
